Thank you to everyone who listened and asked questions on my #CA39 Telephone Town Hall this evening. While I wasn't able to get to everyone's question, please reach out to my office about PPE, stimulus checks, small business support, and anything else. We're here to help.

Curtis from #CA39: What accountability are you taking to ensure Administration officials are held accountable?

Congress has a major oversight role. We take this seriously. This is something we'll discuss deeply after this crisis, so that we can better be prepared for the future.

Rick from Fullerton: The Defense Production Act. Is it being used to get test kits?

I have been advocating for the President to use the DPA in its fullest capacity, to make test kits, PPE, ventilators and other supplies. #CA39

Jean from Diamond Bar: Do you support hazard pay?

I support hazard pay. I sent a letter to leadership in Congress to provide hazard pay and workplace protections to our workers on the frontline. I will fight and continue to advocate for this. #CA39

Chris from Diamond Bar: What are you doing to protect the Asian American #AAPI community? I was verbally assaulted.

We've been seeing an upswing in discrimination & racism toward our AAPI community. I will continue to speak out against xenophobia, racism & discrimination. (1/2)

Tyson from Placentia: What are the conversations you're having with your colleagues about a next stimulus bill? 

We need to provide more relief for our small businesses, hospitals, and workers. I've also been advocating for more funding for our smaller cities. #CA39

#CA39 question: "When will our grocery store workers get PPE?"

Our grocery store workers are going above and beyond to help and support CA-39. We've provided the funding to bring more PPE to our communities. We'll continue to find more resources so that everyone is staying safe.

Meika from La Habra: What communication is going out in terms of education? How do you plan on helping K-12 parents and students?

I have 2 young boys, 6-year-old twins. I know education during the coronavirus is a concern of all of our parents and teachers. (1/3)

Sandeep from Diamond Bar: There are rumors that banks are running out of funding, and that Republicans & Democrats are at a stand still. What do you stand on this?

I was a small business owner. I know what it's like to struggle to keep your doors open. Small businesses are (1/3)

Justin from #CA39: When it comes the the CARES Act what else can be done to help college students who do not qualify for the stimulus checks?

It's an injustice that they don't. One of the things I'm advocating in the next stimulus package, is that college students (1/2)

Taylor from #CA39: I have completed an SBA application online. I was told there would be no confirmation email. I'm wondering when I should expect to hear back?

I know this is a stressful situation for our small business owners. I was talking to an SBDC rep today, (1/2)

Bill from Fullerton: Is there an adequate amount of #COVID19 testing kits for people who want to get tested in the district?

I'm not going to beat around the bush. No. There are not enough in the district, not enough in the country. We need to make sure we're get testing. (1/2)

Jason from #CA39: What if anything can you do to help with homeless issues in my area?

Funding has already been provided from the #CARESAct to help our homeless population. We have to work together to ensure that everyone is staying safe and healthy throughout this crisis.

Payul from Yorba Linda: "What is the timeline of the stimulus checks?"

Some people have already received their checks through direct deposit. I can't give a definite timeline, but I ask people to be patient as checks are being cut and sent out.

Ashok from #CA39: "I have applied for EIDL w/SBA 10 days ago. I need to know how long until I should receive the loan?"

SBA has been overwhelmed right now. And I'll continue to raise this issue with the SBA to ensure our small businesses get the resources they need.
